posts.author: scoobytoobins
posts.post_text: November 30, 2020 at 6:03 PM#2$ denotes a variable.= are used to set variables.and "" are used to set or remove variables.see manual here

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: November 30, 2020 at 6:36 PM#3HiYou don't need = to set a variable : setvar $var = x is same as setvar $var xIn fact, = is nothing in gma2's command line syntax. It doesn't exist.You can just use it for readibility."string" is to set a string : setvar $name "my name""" can be used to delete a variable, but as = , it's useless.Setvar $name "my name", to set the var.Setvar $name       to delete itYou also can read thisSpecial charactersEnjoy

title: macro  symbol
